website_summaries.verdict: The TiVo Mini, which lets you watch live programming and your TiVo recordings on another television, is a new toy for current Premiere 4 DVR owners, but it has too many restrictions to be the killer product that TiVo aficionados are looking for.
pros: Streams TiVo content to other TVs
Replaces one DVR or set top box
Supports Hulu Plus, Spotify, Pandora, and other apps
cons: Doesn't work with two-tuner TiVo Premieres or Series 3/HD DVRs

customer_reviews.title: Love TiVo
customer_reviews.text: Even though TiVo does seem to go astray on occasion, the whole house TiVo DVR system along with its program guide and recording capabilities are a BIG success in our house. TiVo is not cheap, but once you own it, the savings from avoiding the cable company set top box costs can be very significant. Don't forget to buy your own cable modem too since that will probably ave you a bundle after a year or so.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Tivo has not only addressed all of those problems they have made it easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The original Mini had many problems, it used channels on your primary Tivo box, it was unreliable, it was expensive to use. Tivo has not only addressed all of those problems they have made it easy to use, you can view shows from multiple systems, the picture is great. If I still have any complaints about Tivo and the Mini, it is their set up process, it can be very frustrating. You have to basically set it up and leave it alone for one or two days to complete the configuration. The other concern I have with Tivo overall, their streaming off premise is unreliable and copying to a device like an iPad is also unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: The current price includes LIFETIME ACTIVATION! Supposedly that's a limned time offer till Jan 2015. Word is that TiVo's working on a wireless version of the Mini and they're trying to clear the older units out? Setup is a bit convoluted... You need to add this new device to tour TiVo account, wait 20 min, plug it in- do the "guided setup", reboot/force service connect your main TiVo, then reboot the Mini... and they'll all work together perfectly. If you get the V70 error with a red circle/line over your existing TiVo's... repeat the above procedure.
customer_reviews.author: Sci-Fi Fan

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with this little device! It took a ...
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this little device! It took a few hours for the activation to go through. When going through the setup, it would get to a point where it said it couldn't find another TiVo on the same network. As it turns out, that was because the Mini wasn't yet activated. I'm not sure why it took so long to activate or why the message didn't just tell me it wasn't activated. There was an option to "Try again" that seemed to just cycle through over and over. Once the device was activated, it was a snap, but it seems the instructions/on-screen info could have been a little more clear about waiting a few (5 in my case) hours.
customer_reviews.author: MTMATT

customer_reviews.title: the ONLY bad thing with this is taht does not have WIFI
customer_reviews.text: got Tivo Mini for the bedroom you need a TIVO dvr to make this work ..the ONLY bad thing with this is taht does not have WIFI , as my bedroom was already wired it made no difference to me . , connected them to my Home Network and i was up and running in less than an hour , and saving over $100 per month, you can access netflix ,hulu+ , you tube , the new ONE PASS will find your shows even if they are on Youtube of Hulu+
customer_reviews.author: King Fahad

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer but a bit behind the times in the hardware dept.
customer_reviews.text: remote is slightly different than the Romio which leads to a confusion factor when switching from one room to another. The "Guide" button and others are in diffferent places. The remote is not backlit and the font on the buttons is too small. In 2013 it does NOT have wireless capability (regardless of what a salesman says at a big box store) and TVIO does not reccomend or support wireless. However...I have done it and it works well..I did notice a performance slow down when Mini and Romio were in use at the same time and it was not netwoprk related..just slow in responding.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W.

customer_reviews.title: doesnt work. connected to my local network and gets ...
customer_reviews.text: doesnt work. connected to my local network and gets an error that it cannot connect to my roamio. called tivo and after an hour they tell me that this is a known issue. nothing special in my network - just a standard, wired ethernet connection to the ethernet switch that the roamio is plugged into. don't buy until tivo get's its quality issues worked out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love Tivo and I love the mini with its MOCA ...
customer_reviews.text: I love Tivo and I love the mini with its MOCA networking. The only thing I'm fairly ticked about is IR remote that is bulkier and has a different configuration than the Roamio's beautiful RF remote. Tivo also happily "let" me pay the $6/month service fee for a year before I called in one time and happen to ask and they said "guess what, we will upgrade you to lifetime for free". Gee, thanks I guess, for the kind of nonsense that Comcast pulls.
customer_reviews.author: Colbster

customer_reviews.title: Activation takes too long !!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Rommeo Plus and ran a new CAT 6 cable between by router and the mini. All I get is digital breakup so far. It takes 24 hours from the time you activate the box and the server finally downloads the information to the box to allow you to actually use it. Customer service stated "it is always slow. We complain to management and can't get them to do anything about it". I am going to connect the Mini directly to a new cable run on the floor to see if I have a bad cable (it was new). I will re-visit my review if I am able to make any progress fixing it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Dave

customer_reviews.title: TiVo Mini....but Big!!
customer_reviews.text: It took a long time, (one month exactly), to work out all the bugs to not only get my TiVo Roamio to function properly, but to also get the Mini working properly. I hung in and I'm VERY glad I did. TiVo is so easy and intuitive to use. With the Mini it's great being able to have one DVR set up in one room and be able to watch, record, and view already recorded shows in another room. THE BEST PART IS YOU DON'T HAVE TO PAY CABLE OR SATELLITE COMPANIES their outrageous fees (and taxes on top of the fees)!!!!!!!!! GREAT PRODUCTS AND I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THEM.
customer_reviews.author: Music Man

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great.
customer_reviews.text: The TiVo Minis are great. The new version is much preferred but the price for the old ones makes it appealing. This one is good for installations where you don't have to put it behind cabinets or if you have a universal remote with a RF or bluetooth receiver. Interface is great for watching shows recorded on TiVo but the interface for other connected and streaming services leaves something to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Chang

customer_reviews.title: Old Version remote stinks
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t realize that “old version “ meant no‘back’ buttons so the TiVo Mini works perfectly but the remote sucks. You can work your way around it, just not as convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Tivo Mini is Great
customer_reviews.text: The Tivo Mini has been a great way to extend the six-tuner capacity of the Roamio Pro to three other rooms in the house without requiring additional monthly fees, cable cards, or tuning adapters. This is much more feature rich than the digital adapter that the cable company requires at a minimum to decode any channels these days. I highly recommend the Mini as an economical way to bridge the Roamio or Bolt services to other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great Tivo Add on.
customer_reviews.text: Great way to extend your Tivo Roamio capabilities to other TV's. Good price through Amazon then I bought the Lifetime Subscription. The Lifetime Subscription seems a little steep for this device since you I already have one on the Tivo Roamio, I feel like this should just be a device you buy to extend the Roamio capability. But any rate, Tivo is superb to other DVR's and it is nice to get it on another TV. Remote works well and I have not had any connection problems using MoCa. This is where the internet connection comes through the Coax cable and you don't need ethernet running to the device.
customer_reviews.author: deuce73

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Tivo Roamio Pro
customer_reviews.text: Menu system is now upgraded to match that of Roamio Pro, and with the latter's ability to record up to 6 shows at once, it is far cheaper to use a TiVo Mini for other TV sets instead of two or more TiVo boxes. Only downside is that the network between the Roamio to the Mini has an issue about 5% of the time. It seems to resolve itself after a short downtime. TiVo is just an amazing smart box system, and it will soon work with XFinity OnDemand, so there is absolutely no reason not to go with TiVo.
customer_reviews.author: DSE

customer_reviews.title: OK, but get the newer one for better reliability.
customer_reviews.text: It's OK, but the newer Mini is much better. I use this in the spare room/den/exercise room. When using the HDMI ARC (audio return channel), It takes a frustrating while for the inexpensive receiver to start the audio after the picture is playing for several seconds. Not sure if it's the TV, receiver or the TiVo Mini. Also, when their is a temporary power glitch, the Mini has to be powered off and back on to hear audio. I wound up getting a Backup Power Supply to avoid the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great add on to a Tivo Roamio
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 Tivo Minis to go with my Tivo Roamio... finally able to dump my Verizon FIOS set top boxes and DVR. Glad I made the switch and will never look back. These Minis let me get the full Tivo experience on each of our TVs without having to have a dedicated Tivo DVR for each. Love it! The biggest deficiency in my book for Tivo is the lack of Amazon Prime Instant Videos access. You can view Amazon content that you rent/buy via the Tivo, but not content already in your library or available to Amazon Prime members. Major bummer! Fix that problem and I'll be calling Tivo Roamio + Tivo Mini as close to perfect as possible... :-)
customer_reviews.author: KcKCkc

customer_reviews.title: Still having trouble with this unit. It really is ...
customer_reviews.text: Still having trouble with this unit. It really is that you need a wired connection. I've tried a wireless bridge (ones that plug into the ethernet port), powerline, etc...none have given a stable connection. So, I'm still working on getting this to work well with my tivo roamio.
customer_reviews.author: Elysium

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a way to send live TV to another set in the house. We love our Premiere XL4 and thought the Mini would be the perfect addition to our bedroom without buying a full size device. It handles our recorded shows very well and live TV makes it the perfect device. The reason I only give 4 stars is that the Mini does not have Netflix or Amazon Video capabilities and those features in themselves would be worth the price. This device is blazing fast. Faster even than our XL4. It is a great device when a family is looking to add TV to another part of the house.
customer_reviews.author: jbonham

customer_reviews.title: Game changing
customer_reviews.text: The TiVo Mini has extended the usefulness of our TiVo Roamio Plus so significantly that I cannot imagine any better use of money on entertainment. For a couple hundred dollars, we now have three televisions that can access all of the things on the TiVo, including the applications for our Amazon Prime Video, Netflix, Hulu, and other services. We have found the old version without RF remote to be more than adequate for our use, but if the RF remote is handy, be sure to seek out the newer version of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lee. Smallwood

customer_reviews.title: Long time aspirations of DVR and streamed movies around the house has arrived
customer_reviews.text: For years I have been wanting to watch my DVR or stream movies off my computer on every TV in the house. However, prior options for doing this were complicated and very expensive. Now with my TIVO Roamie Pro, TIVO Mini's, and the PLEX Server and app, I get my wish while using the existing co-ax network already in the walls. I did have to upgrade my co-ax splitter with an RF Amplifier (IPA2008DL2-RSVF by Extreme Broadband) once I got past 3 TV's, but now I have great signal even with some older RG-59 co-ax mixed in the network. The video quality on the TIVO Mini's is great and they are very responseive.
customer_reviews.author: redman

customer_reviews.title: Minor Issues but a Great Product Overall
customer_reviews.text: I love the TiVo Mini as a cable box replacement. So far I can watch TV fine on the box and it does pretty much everything that a TiVo does minus the hard drive. I do have a couple of minor issues with the box. One is that if the network drops you have to restart the program from the beginning. Not a major deal, bust still I would like to pick up where I left off. Also, once in a while, it will lose the main TiVo and then streaming stops and you may have to reboot either the main TiVo or the TiVo Mini to see the main TiVo again.
customer_reviews.author: AZMedGuy

customer_reviews.title: I have been pretty happy with these
customer_reviews.text: I have been pretty happy with these. I have two. My cable company recently removed any programming from any TV without renting a box from them. This allows me to do anything the Tivo will do in other rooms. It does take a tuner while in use so if you have four tuners like me, you can only use three on the tivo while watching live TV on a mini. It does release the tuner when not using it. That is a new thing that was not available on my Tivo when I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: consumer22

customer_reviews.title: Great "portability"
customer_reviews.text: My wife considers the patio to be her "man cave." And she likes to watch TV at times. Seeing how other DVR, etc., services had such an easy to use record here, watch there feature, she wanted something like that. This unit achieves that. One caveat which is why I only gave it 4 stars ... it is expected that you will be using an HDMI connection. If you want something less than that because the TV you will be using is less than that, you will need to purchase the extra cables to connect it. Not a hassle but something i did not know/understand when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Markie

customer_reviews.title: I really like my Tivo Roamio & Mini
customer_reviews.text: The Tivo Roamio works great with our over-the-air stations and the software is fast and easy to use. Netflix also works great. The Tivo Mini works well once I figured out the problems with it losing connection to the Roamio. Both devices are connected to our LAN via power line adapters. At first, I figured it was these causing all the connection drops and subsequent troubles reconnecting. I then discovered if I never put the Mini in standby mode, the connection never dropped! I now avoid standby mode like the plague on both devices.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas King

customer_reviews.title: Best entertainment system ever
customer_reviews.text: My brother introduced me to TIVO - before that I was paying a ridiculous amount of money each month to rent Fios boxes that provided a fraction of the entertainment options. I am so happy! Word to the wise, Fios does not like it when you switch, you have to call them to ask for a video card for Tivo and they will tell you that you need a card for each TV in your home, NOT TRUE,you only need one card for the main box and then all your mini-Tivo boxes are independently operational. Takes less than a year to recoup your money for buying the boxes.
customer_reviews.author: analyzethis

customer_reviews.title: Makes having a TV in our busiest rooms a cinch!
customer_reviews.text: Having access to all the functions of the Roamio Pro through the Tivo Mini is absolutely great! A change on one mini, is a system change without having to go to the central location. Special note: Even though the system worked just OK (4 mini's and Roamio Pro) on the built in WiFi with access points for each Mini, I installed the MoCA adapter (purchased the Actiontec Ethernet to Coax Adapter for Homes with Cable TV Service (ECB2500C) from Amazon and WOW! it all came together. I am a very happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: Gary T

customer_reviews.title: looooooove the small footprint. .easy to set up via MOCA.
customer_reviews.text: Wow..We are a Tivo family, since the first Tivo...and using this with the premier tivo (4 tuners). Set up was easy via MOCA, (tried it with ethernet, wouldn't connect). Since we purchased this during a tivo promotion, the set up was quick, without a separate connection to HQ. We have lifetime with it. Easy to use as it connects to our Premier. We use a Harmony remote, which makes it even more easier to use and it is compatible. We just purchased another one to put in another room, and retire an older Tivo.
customer_reviews.author: Sincerely Yours

customer_reviews.title: Worthy additions with lifetime
customer_reviews.text: I switched to TiVO DVR (Roamio Pro) over Xfinity X1 (and AT&T U-verse prior) because TiVO Mini has lifetime (promo to end of 2014). This allows me to have flexibility of lots of TiVO minis for each room (not necessarily all used at same time) without paying a bundle every month. The performance for playback on recordings is quite good, unlike my previous systems that were laggy when fast forward or rewind. I also like the fact that I can some some of these receivers on MoCA, and others on ethernet.
customer_reviews.author: JSC

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. Placed in the exercise room so now I have TiVo while I'm walking. So much better than just "live" TV. I love the TiVo mini. I've got three in my house. They are very easy to set up and just about fool proof. My network is a hybrid--both Ethernet and MOCA. It works flawlessly. One set-up comment: it would be helpful if TiVo instructions indicated that if you have an Ethernet connection already, you need only one MOCA adapter (with ROAMIO) and not two.
customer_reviews.author: Dick Riess

customer_reviews.title: works flawless after you finish the set up..but consider take your time.
customer_reviews.text: The product works as described. only thing it takes a little effort in order to connect with my tiro roam..just keep in mind always you need to call the company in order to use otherwise you waste your time. after that you don't have any worries. keep in mind if you have a tiro roam 500gb you will need a moca connection in order to work with your broadband cable. needs a network connection in order to use. or just simple plug directly to your modem via ethernet. but not in my case. i will recommend this product if you have a little tech skills otherwise you will get frustrate. keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Lukhas

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORKING - KNOWN PROBLEM with Error V70 - TIVO is working on the fix.
customer_reviews.text: Tivo Mini is not working - Tivo knows there is a problem (error V70) and is working on it. I've struggled for 2 weeks to get it work, replaced with new one, same story. The problem is, Tivo is playing dumb and saying nothing, allowing you to waste hours and days before admitting it. UPDATE: Month later since the purchase and another software update from Tivo - IT'S ALIVE!!! Working as described, great quality and convenience. Got rid of dreaded Verizon box finally and bought another Mini.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gustek

customer_reviews.title: Tivo Mini
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 Tivo Mini's to work with my Roamio Plus DVR. So far, everything has worked like I expected it to. I can access recorded shows from the Roamio Plus, schedule new ones from the Mini and watch LiveTV as if I'm on the Roamia Plus. I have 2 Mini's connected using an existing MoCA network, 1 using Ethernet over Powerline and 1 using a wireless bridge. No issues on any of them. This has allowed me to return all of my cable companies boxes and save money. I highly recommend the Tivo Mini.
customer_reviews.author: Navy Chief

customer_reviews.title: Best DVR out there
customer_reviews.text: I love my TiVo. It is the best DVR I have ever used. It actually call it a DVR and to place it in a category with vendor supplied boxes is an injustice to the TiVo brand. They truly know what they are doing with their product and put out a much superior product. To those that are worried about the cost. In the end you will actually save money by going to this superior product. I do not regret buying this product especially during this promotion that doesn't charge me an extra fee for each mini I have. I started off with one extra mini and will definitely be buying 2 more before the promotion ends.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dobson

customer_reviews.title: Great product - saves a bundle over time.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product because, since you can watch live TV by "borrowing" a tuner from the host DVR, it effectively replaces an HD cable box ($10/month savings with Comcast). It also has Netflix and Hulu on it so could eliminate the need for another device like Roku, Apple TV, Chromecast etc. NOTE: TIVO is running a special promotion during Oct-Dec 2014 where you get the mini for FREE if you buy lifetime service for $150. You can call Tivo sales directly to take advantage of this offer.
customer_reviews.author: Danny M

customer_reviews.title: Love it !!!
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my Tivo Roamio. Was easy to install and have had no technical issues. On the functionality side, however, I have the Mini connected to my computer monitor which doesn't have built in speakers. Luckily, the monitor has an audio output port. I wish the Mini itself had such a port. There are Composite and A/V ports but you can't use them to connect directly to computer speakers. Minor issue but could have been major if my monitor didn't have the external audio port.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great device!
customer_reviews.text: Now that service is included, these are a great value. Just built a new house and have my roamio in a rack in the attic, and mini's around house for TV's.. small footprint makes it easy to stick them everywhere. I've been with TiVo since 2002 and this kind of stuff is what keeps me. Cable co DVR's are terrible!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Libby

customer_reviews.title: Is great, but I think the extra service fee to use is still lame.
customer_reviews.text: The TiVo Mini is pretty good. I'm using this with the TiVo Roamio Plus. But I think that since this is totally dependant on your existing TiVo and service (uses guide data from your main TiVo unit, shares recorded programs, etc) - I think the extra service fee to use the Mini is lame. That said, it works well - is really responsive and I have used it over both ethernet and built in MoCa (Tivo Roamio also supports this).
customer_reviews.author: S. Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Tivo Minis are great little devices that work wonderfully over Mocha to provide ...
customer_reviews.text: Tivo Minis are great little devices that work wonderfully over Mocha to provide remote DVR capabilities without the extra cost of multiple Tivos. The only thing that I don't like is the setup. Once it is setup it works wonderfully and reliably. The setup is problematic, requiring the main Tivo and the Minis to call in to Tivo online multiple times. This is nowhere in the setup instructions, and even after multiple call ins the Mini still needs time to......setup?.....I guess? One tip I can give is to assign the mini to a static IP address within your network. It helps with the reliability of the system tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Best addition to our home entertainment systems
customer_reviews.text: Best addition to our home entertainment systems. We had recently upgraded to a roamio and got a mini when we ordered it. We'd kept a Comcast box in the bedroom initially but were so pleased with the mini in my daughter's room we got another for the master bedroom. Now video is easily shared throughout the house and allows live TV as well without running coax all over the place. Note that they say you cannot use wifi with these but I've had good luck on both of ours with 802.11ac adapters.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great way to extend TiVo to other rooms in the house.
customer_reviews.text: This unit has been awesome! Extended having a TiVo Roamio to another room in the house. Does nearly everything the main unit does. Only gap I've discovered is I can't transfer a program from my PC to the TiVo using the Mini unit. However, if I have a show that was transferred from the PC to the TiVo and it's not listed in the program list, you can play it. Fantastic and cheap way to make sure your house only has to have one brain.
customer_reviews.author: Clarice S.

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Mini at the same time as a Roamio Plus. There was some initial setup issues on the TiVo side and I had to wait 24 hours for the Roamio and Plus to find each other, but otherwise the Mini has been working flawlessly. It would be nice if the interface on the Mini were updated to look like the Roamio. I've heard rumors that TiVo is working on that. The Mini is a great solution for me, as it enabled me to retire an old Series 3 TiVo and remove one of the 9.95 additional outlet charges from Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great quality hardware
customer_reviews.text: I'm becoming more and more amazed at TiVo quality. Remote works without the dreaded pointing shake of your arm at the device. I often forget it's not RF because it works around objects. Tiny box is easily concealed. I'm using Cat5 which seems okay. Had some issues with first time setup, but it finally connected. Love the TiVo hardware and this is no exception. With the lifetime activation, this is a bargain over cable.
customer_reviews.author: Tensy

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected, and I love it
customer_reviews.text: I don't see the reason for the negative reviews for this device. it works as you'd expect, and Tivo has not misrepresented this unit at all. It's not a full-blown Tivo box, and it isn't claimed to be anything but a Tivo DVR client for another TV. That being said, I love it. It works well, and the only problem I've seen is the short delay, maybe 2 or 3 seconds, when changing the Live channel; this delay is not evident when watching recorded shows.
customer_reviews.author: R. Blacker

customer_reviews.title: Tivo Mini
customer_reviews.text: I like it. I tried those other video transfer things. NOT so good sent them all back. The only catch is you have to buy a new TiVo box so that the TiVo mini will work. Still once in a while when I first turn it on after it has been off over night there is no sound but I change channels the sound comes back. I also think that the monthly fee is stupid it should be included in the main TiVo billing. I also think it should have wireless capability. All things considered it works better than the ones that say they can transfer threw walls and ceilings.
customer_reviews.author: Randy A. Walter

customer_reviews.title: Provides access to my main DVR in other rooms
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these connected to a Tivo Roamio Plus. After activating the Tivo service on each of the boxes, they connected to the Roamio Plus and provided me with live and recorded TV in the 2 rooms. It also provides some casting features for apps like Netflix and Youtube to be casted to my TV from my iPhone or iPad. The only downside is the extra subscription cost for the Tivo service on each device. It's worth it to me, though, to have the added TV capability in the other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with TiVo
customer_reviews.text: For several years I had AT&T U-Verse, but it simply became too expensive. I found that I could get good reception with a UHF antenna, so I cancelled the service and bought a Roamio TiVo for my main TV and a Mini for the second TV. I actually find the reception to be better for the most part than cable, and TiVo's interface and responsiveness is far better. Recording shows works perfectly, and I am saving nearly $100 per month. I would highly recommend TiVo to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: David Wagner

customer_reviews.title: The device is pretty small and unassuming and doesn't make any sound so ...
customer_reviews.text: Using this with a Roamio to get TV to our basement. Can't really tell you're streaming from the Roamio. Play, FF, RW all work as fast as they do on the main Roamio. Other functions such as Pandora, Netflix and Youtube work just as well as they do on the Roamio. The device is pretty small and unassuming and doesn't make any sound so great for pretty much any room.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Remote Should Be The Latest Version
customer_reviews.text: The TiVo mini looks and feels like a standard TiVo box except for a couple of things. One, there is no live view in the upper right corner when you're looking through My Shows. Second is the remote. I have a Roamio Plus and I love that the remote is a little smaller than in the past and I like the placement of the buttons. When I got my mini, the remote was the bigger, older remote and the buttons aren't in the same place. Please standardize these. It confuses my wife!
customer_reviews.author: M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works great as dedicated TiVo with SlingBox
customer_reviews.text: Previously I had my Slingbox connected to my TiVo Roamio which was great for mirroring my Roamio but it made it difficult to use the slingbox when the Roamio was being used. Luckily I have the Roamio Plus with 6 tuners and so when the refurb TiVo Mini went on sale for a great price, it seemed like an easy solution to free up the Roamio and still watch the programs stored on the TiVo along with live TV and all the apps, like netflix and amazon prime. One thing to remember is that the Slingbox "remote" is address 0, so be sure to block the IR signal from other TiVos.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S.

customer_reviews.title: Tivo mini beats big honking Service provider box in every bedroom (or a dongle that does nothing)
customer_reviews.text: excellent client for TIVO Roamio server devices- works flawlessly and extends TIVO main DVR to your remote rooms--saves a bundle on leasing gear from cable companies--service contract prices at least have dropped for minis which may have been sticking point for many--its well worth paying the one time fee as it pays for iteslf in short time....I will never go back to service provider set top boxes, DVRs and uselss dongles at absurd fees..
customer_reviews.author: UnimPeachable

customer_reviews.title: Great once I figure out how to make it work ...
customer_reviews.text: Great once I figure out how to make it work with Roamio and home network, there was a major learning curve for me but very happy with it now that it works like its suppose to. Tip for anyone having problems keeping a connection to host DVR is to assign static IP addresses to each device. Once I did that everything worked like it was supposed to. I now have 2 of these and a Tivo Roamio and 0 cable boxes😊
customer_reviews.author: T M

customer_reviews.title: Best way to trim the cable bill
customer_reviews.text: I was able to get rid of 5 cable box fees and the DVR fee from my cableco. This setup works perfectly over MOCA, just make sure you have it set up correctly, there are lots of ways to set it up. Tivo Forums is a great resource. The hardest part was getting the cablecard paired with my service, save yourself some hassle and try and get a tier 2 tech to pair the card. Overall a great way to have whole house DVR.
customer_reviews.author: embryjim

customer_reviews.title: Love TiVo & now love the TiVo mini!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned various TiVo units for years. Love lifetime service. TiVo minis allow me to stream, view on two other TV's on my MOCA network--a great alternative to cable boxes. Love that lifetime service is included in the price of the mini. Only problem was on one of my TV's, but that was a bad cable wire issue I think. TiVo customer service is great, and Amazon's return policy was fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Now we have minis in 3 rooms and a Full sized TiVo in one room and it works great. Since the main Tivo can record 4 shows ...
customer_reviews.text: Decided to cut the cord with cable and got a Tivo and several minis to service our entire house. Now we have minis in 3 rooms and a Full sized TiVo in one room and it works great. Since the main Tivo can record 4 shows at once, we haven't needed anything else. If you are considering cutting the cord with cable, I highly recommend Tivo products.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: TIVO Mini is Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the performance of my TIVO Mini and it's interaction with my Roamio Plus. I had no problem setting up the Mini using a MOCA network connection, and the Mini performs fantastically with very little, if any, delay in performing commands. I can stop watching a show in the living room and pick it up in the bedroom on the Mini, plus I can set up recordings on the Mini just like I can on the Roamio. The Mini is also a great value since I don't have to pay a separate TIVO monthly fee for it since it comes with lifetime service out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: RandyS

customer_reviews.title: It also is unrealistic and annoying that they assume that everyone is going to have ...
customer_reviews.text: After you get through the very unintuitive setup (had to use the settings menus on this and my Roamio to "connect to TV TiVo service" several times), it worked most of the time. However, I still have issues sometimes with the connection to to the Roamio dropping. It could be that the wireless bridge I'm using isn't very stable, but they could at least say "loading/buffering" instead of just giving up and kicking me back to the home screen. It also is unrealistic and annoying that they assume that everyone is going to have a wired network to hook this thing up. Its 2014, and 802.11n/ac has plenty of bandwidth to run a TiVo video stream.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan B.

customer_reviews.title: Tivo Mini
customer_reviews.text: I got the mini so I could access my Roamio dvr from the bed room. It works really well, and Netflix is on there as well. I found it a little tricky to initially setup, my DVR would not get detected correctly. But after having the Roamio in the living room reconnect with Tivo it worked fine. Highly recommend if you have a Roamio, plus the live TV is handy since I use an outdoor antennae and it is only hooked up to my living room,
customer_reviews.author: John F. Markham

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but wish it would run wireless
customer_reviews.text: This works great. The biggest issue is that a hardwired connection is needed. I wish it could have just run on the wireless network like the Tivo Roamio box could by itself. Since I couldn't get an ethernet connection to the location for the base Roamio, I had to implement a moca network using the Actiontec boxes. Cost me an additional $100 to to this, but it is much better than paying the cable and satellite companies over $100 every month.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Alternative to Cable Box
customer_reviews.text: I love my Tivo Mini's. I have 2. They work just like my main Tivo which is a Roamio. The only problem I have encountered is both Mini's seem to lose the connection with the Roamio and the only fix is to restart the Roamio. They are all on the same network and same router so I don't know why it does this. But, I love the Mini and will probably never go back to have additional cable boxes.
customer_reviews.author: thepit47

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective - Tidy
customer_reviews.text: I liked the idea of tying the Mini to a main Tivo thus eliminating the need for an additional cable card. Switching to the mini not only reduces my monthly fee for the service, but it also eliminated a $10 fee for an additional cable card. The lifetime subscription fee is very reasonable as well. I intend to buy one more to eliminate another Tivo and cable card saving me even more. Most of the other features mimic the standard Tivos.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Tivo is great and a money saver!
customer_reviews.text: I got Tivo because I'm a cord cutter, but still wanted the option to add a cable card later on if I ever decide to. Having Tivo is like having cable again. It's a high up front cost, but it's cheaper than renting cable boxes. Even if I went back to cable I would stick with my Tivo, as it's a cheaper and better solution than cable boxes. The Tivo Mini is just like having the Tivo in the other room. It's basically a whole home DVR solution for a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome over MOCA connection
customer_reviews.text: Makes me wonder why it too so long to get a Tivo... (oh ya, the price commitment). But now I regret not just taking the plunge earlier. As a Over the Air guy, TV was hard to watch at times. Nothing seemed to be on. But with a TiVo, there's always something recorded that gets my interest. And the Mini works GREAT with my Roamio, just like a full size Tivo
customer_reviews.author: tm81663

customer_reviews.title: Mini installation issues worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great once up and running. The website should have been MUCH more clear about the need to set up Moca with the base level Roamio even if the primary TIVO is connected via Ethernet. The good news was that I did get a prompt answer to my question, but I may not have purchased the mini if I had been smart enough to ask about the need for Moca first. Adding 2 adapters adds $100 to the cost. I now think it was worth it, though, and going forward I can add more minis with no adapters needed. I think I'm glad I wasn't smart enough to ask the network question first!
customer_reviews.author: Chabotjo

customer_reviews.title: Basic Review
customer_reviews.text: I'm no writer wanna-be, so I will "Keep it Simple, Stupid" Based on functionality, this device deserves 5 stars. Based on my opinion that getting bombarded with ads while using a paid for service is unacceptable, the device deserves 1 star. Average those 2 together, and you get 3 stars. Amazon Prime was great as usual, but that's not what this review is about.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome device! Delivers TiVo to any room you want. I use it for OTA from my Roamio basic, but if I ever want to get a CableCard it would be awesome because I wouldn't need to pay the cable co for another box. This uses a tuner from the Roamio. Also, I am using it "wirelessly" with a Airport Express. So I have the Roamio connected to the Airport Extreme and the Mini connected wirelessly to the extreme using the express. Haven't had a single issue with it streaming my shows, live, or Netflix.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Sousa

customer_reviews.title: Much better than Verizon HD DVR
customer_reviews.text: I love the Tivo Mini. The menu, remote and service is superior to Verizon Fios HD DVR. I'm paying a lot less for better quality. I'm very happy with my purchase and bought an extra one and returned my monthly rental set to Verizon. I just need to rent one digital cable card for $5 a month from Verizon instead of $20 for each DVR.
customer_reviews.author: §tealth

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but...
customer_reviews.text: The TiVo Mini is a great idea, but I dislike the idea of having to pay a monthly fee to use this in addition to the monthly fee of the DVR from which it works. Operation is fairly simply although it occasionally freezes, then resets itself in the middle of a program for no apparent reason. Wish it could work over our WiFi network rather than having to be hardwired to the network. Although I see room for improvement, I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Ron M

customer_reviews.title: Well done, with some quirks.
customer_reviews.text: I like the TiVo Mini, but it has a few annoying quirks compared to using a real TiVo. For example, if you have a buffer and hit record, it won't include your buffer and will start recording separately from the point at which you hit record. And you can't cycle through the other TiVo inputs. But for use on an auxiliary TV (e.g. Bedroom) it's great to have all your shows in one place and have a cheap way to access them from another TV. We have FiOS, so the MOCA networking worked right out of the box, and has generally worked very well. The lag between making a selection and having it play is minimal.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with a TiVo Roamio
customer_reviews.text: Use this in the bedroom to connect to the TiVo Roamio in the living room. I connected it to my router via Ethernet and it works well with fast response. Initially, my connections were via 3 Ethernet switches to the Roamio. This occasionally caused a momentary dropped signal a few times a week. I was able to eliminate 1 switch and have only had one momentary signal drop during the past few weeks. Overall, very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony DeMore

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I ditched my Verizon-provided FiOS DVR in lieu of this box. I bought the Lifetime activation, so it'll pay for itself in about 1.5 years. Edit: it's now been almost that 1.5 years (now January 2016) and it's still going strong. In fact, by kids use the TiVo apps more than the Fios + WDTV that has also been discarded since.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Tivo....  Why did i wait so long?
customer_reviews.text: After being frustrated with rental fees from my cable provider and wanting to expand our viewing capabilities, I gave up. On the cable boxes that is. Hello TiVo and TiVo mini! After connecting them all over my existing coax (no new cable runs) I now have DVR capabilities in every room and no more rental fees! Ever!
customer_reviews.author: GTO

customer_reviews.title: Great device with no problems after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase for us and saved a bit of money from buying it directly from Tivo. This Mini has not had any problems and the setup was a breeze. Too bad the remote is slightly different from our Roamio remote, but not a huge deal. This is a quality product that we have been using for 7 months with no problems. Thanks Tivo and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan W

customer_reviews.title: tivo rocks
customer_reviews.text: I've been away from tivo devices for 6 years and I have to say I am really impressed in what they have done. Everything works and works well. I like all the integration with other online services. Also the tivo mini is awesome. I also like watching from my Android and iPad tablet or phones. Wish I could watch from pc or mac. Fantastic. .. best purchase I've made in a while.
customer_reviews.author: cowboycctx

customer_reviews.title: I love Tivo
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first Tivo in March of 2001 - no, that's not a typo. That's 13 years of Tivo, and 13 years without having to have a cable box. The DVR from Comcast may be free, but the feature set on the Comcast software for their DVRs is seriously limited compared to Tivo, which I know from occasionally watching TV with friends who don't have Tivo. I have a Tivo Premier XL4 and a Tivo mini, and I love that I can access everything from either Tivo in either room.
customer_reviews.author: nancym

customer_reviews.title: Very easy setup & amazing technology
customer_reviews.text: I was new to the whole Tivo experience and jumped on the recommendation of a friend with an older Tivo. I got the Roamio and a pair of Minis and it has revolutionized the way I watch TV. I had a FIOS DVR with 2 tuners and perhaps room for 20-25 hours of hi-def recording. The ability to program was amazing and easy. The recommendations are incredible. I have watched movies and shows that I never would have even looked at in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Tin Can Sailor

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my tivo romario's
customer_reviews.text: Works great with the two six tuner Romario's o have in the house. Be patient when you setup. It takes tivo sync to show it is on active accountable upto 24 hours. Just go thru setup, come back a day or so later and you will be fine. Too like 5 minutes to install, 10 minutes to boot and run thru setup on screen then come back next day. Saves ne about $10 to $15 a month.
customer_reviews.author: SJL

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I have two XL 4 Tivos and this new Tivo Mini is a great addition to our house. Set up was easy and took about 20 minutes with no problems. The user interface is almost the same as the other Tivos in the house except that the mini must use the HD menu display and while I prefer the SD display I can deal with this. Otherwise a great device. Channels and menus are quick and everything works as it should!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great addition! Poor customer support
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product! And Tivo customer support is top shelf! I set mine up with a powerline adapter. Even though its not supported by Tivo it works fine. Every now and then I have to refresh the adapter connection but no big deal... Updated! I am on my third mini. Customer support at Tivo blows!!! On hold forever and the hold music is the worst I've ever heard!
customer_reviews.author: Diesel

customer_reviews.title: Terrific! We've been a TiVo household for over 13 ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrific! We've been a TiVo household for over 13 years and the mini has helped us manage our TV viewing. It allows us to use one main TiVo Roamio Pro DVR as the base unit while attaching several minis via a MoCA network. Set up can be tricky, but there is a mountain of resource material out on the net to help you. Also, TiVo will walk you through the process.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny South

customer_reviews.title: Perfect way to have TiVo and save hundreds of dollars
customer_reviews.text: Connect via cable (won't work on wireless) to an ethernet router, power on, and in ten minutes you have full TiVo service at a quarter the price of a full box. Uses a tuner from another TiVo on the network. Works like a charm. ZERO latency and no impact on the other TiVo's performance. Can view content from other TiVo's on the network from the Mini. Router bridges ethernet and MoCA. LOVE it.
customer_reviews.author: NormCIO

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have a wired or MOCA network before buying!!!
customer_reviews.text: Here is the only reason I gave it 3 stars versus five. You HAVE to install this over a MOCA router. I know it said that in some small type but I didn't see it or pay attention. I have been a TIVO fan since day one and have multiple boxes. I'm sure this will work fine when I get the MOCA set up. I will update once I do.
customer_reviews.author: MSS

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition for extending your Tivo box
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, connected without any problems. I just wish it could start up faster. Once it's up, it's very responsive even when pausing and fast forwarding/rewinding. Warning, if you use it to watch live TV you do lose a "channel" from from the host Tivo box. But once you go back to the start menu, you gain that channel back.
customer_reviews.author: Bc

customer_reviews.title: Terrific, with TiVO's updated lifetime subscription policies
customer_reviews.text: With TiVo now 'giving' lifetime subscription to the TiVo mini's (provided you have a lifetime on a main TiVO, such as a Roamio), makes this terrific. My only nit is that not all 'Settings' can be configured from the TiVO mini -- you need to go to the main Roamio for that. However, it doesn't impact me enough to deduct a star
customer_reviews.author: JMDog

customer_reviews.title: Mini Me
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to do. Easy to setup although it takes a couple of hours to register with the main Tivo box. The only downside is the additional monthly fee which can be avoided by buying a lifetime subscription. With the mini's, I find the additional monthly fee to be "egregious" but that is how the game is played.
customer_reviews.author: TheSRC

customer_reviews.title: Does what I expected, no surprises
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Provides nearly full functionality of the main roamio, lifetime fee included at purchase, compact size Cons: Occasionally it seems to disconnect from the main Roamio. Wish the remote had lighted buttons Seems that there is some more picture breakup on this unit than the main even though they are connected through wired network. But I suppose the issue is the network.
customer_reviews.author: springro

customer_reviews.title: I love this! I live alone and have an older ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I live alone and have an older Tivo Series two that was acting wonky in my living room and a Tivo Roamio in my bedroom. I actually like that I can be watching in the living room and then pick it up where I left off in the bedroom. Very easy set up and small and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Eleanor O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Extend Your TiVo's Reach
customer_reviews.text: The TiVo Mini is a necessity for anyone with a TiVo and more than one TV in the house. All of my recordings on my Roamio Plus are available to watch in whatever room I choose, and can be watched even when the primary Roamio is already in use. Even additional services like Pandora can be accessed through the Mini! Once I worked out the kinks in setting up my own MoCA network in the home, it was smooth sailing. I'm definitely glad I made the investment in this must-have for TiVo owners.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Alternative to a second Tivo box.
customer_reviews.text: This is a more economic solution to having a second Tivo box. It works very well, the ability to watch live TV, manage recordings and have it release its tuner when not being used, make it a complete device. Having to pay an additional subscription fee is the only negative aspect of this device. At the very least, the monthly subscription rate should be $3/mo, not $6. The lifetime subscription price should be $75, not $150.
customer_reviews.author: Tricknees

customer_reviews.title: I must have for TiVo Premiere owners!
customer_reviews.text: Provides most of the features of your TiVo Premiere on another TV in your house. The only thing I wish it had was the ability to stream Netflix, view pictures, manage season passes, and other features available on the TiVo Premier. The TiVo Mini is strictly for playing recorded shows from your TiVo Premiere or live streaming of a channel from your TiVo Premiere.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S.

customer_reviews.title: I LIKE IT
customer_reviews.text: Really nice box, but needs amazon prime streaming, needs ability to talk to pyTivo and needs ability to talk to streambaby. Would be really nice if it had DLNA support. Netflix app is really nice. Streaming live TV and recordings from a Tivo Roamio works really well. Glad I bought it. Might buy another one or two if they add a couple more features that I want.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: Great Device to add Tivo to another Room!!
customer_reviews.text: We have been a Tivo Family for 5+ Years. To be able to add a HD Tivo and eliminate the cable company's SD adpter was awesome. Having to speed $6 a mint to rent the box from verizon has now been eliminated. Please be aware that you will need an Ethernet connection or a MoCa network to utilize the Tivo Mini. Tivo Enginner help me setup the connection.
customer_reviews.author: Dude Reviewing Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Small package with huge output - Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I added the Mini for our bedroom. It has HDMI output and all the same features as the main unit. Add the USB IR repeater and you can hide this totally out of site. Be sure you have a fast home network. If you don't you may experience the picture stopping while buffering more data. I am going to buy two more; one for garage and the other for office.
customer_reviews.author: wowmemalone

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to TiVo Roamio
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 of these along with a Roamio to replace the cable boxes. Really like having the functionality of a DVR on every TV. The MOCA network is also a great feature for rooms that don't have an internet drop. Was able to cut my cable bill by $40 a month by switching and I have much more functionality than before.
customer_reviews.author: Heidiv

customer_reviews.title: Tivo - Outstanding DVR and accessories.
customer_reviews.text: A great money saver and an outstanding home entertainment center for young and old and all those in between. My only gripe is, "I wish I would have bought it sooner!".... The tecnical support and customer service has been very good and were especially helpful on the initial setup and installation.
customer_reviews.author: Don's Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Ethernet to wireless
customer_reviews.text: If anyone is wondering this works perfect for ethernet to wireless on the Tivo mini tested..
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Gomez

customer_reviews.title: TiVO is Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I had DirecTv for 23 years. I was tired of paying them over $100 dollars each month and started to look for something else...I found TiVO. I bought an over the air antenna, a Tivo Romio and two Tivo minis. I now have 63 over-the-air television stations that I can see in all three rooms at the same time. Plus, I get Netflix, Amazon Prime and other streamed content too. TiVO is Fantastic and I do not miss DirecTv at all. If you are tired of the high cable bill, get a TiVo and cut the cord today!
customer_reviews.author: Scott.r

customer_reviews.title: I recommend the Tivo Mini
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent alternative to purchasing two Tivos and having two full subscriptions. One thing that I've experienced is that when going to "Live TV", I often get a message about not connecting to the main Tivo Roamio, which is wrong. When I press the Clear button on the remote, it is connected just fine. I like the idea that I can get to Netflix from the main Tivo and the Mini without other external streaming devices.
customer_reviews.author: Texas M

customer_reviews.title: works great, much faster response time than other DVR sharing I have used.
customer_reviews.text: I cut the cord (15 year Directv customer) and went with a OTA antenna with this Tivo mini and a Tivo Roamio. This works perfectly, my only complaint is Amazon Instant Video is not available on the Mini (from what I read some streaming license issue). I still recommend this unit, as it works flawlessly, there is no delay in response time accessing the Roamio.
customer_reviews.author: Hlindberg

customer_reviews.title: So Sad, You need a Wired Network
customer_reviews.text: So I was planning on cutting cable and ended up having to send my TiVos back. These need a wired home network to operate on and I have U-Verse which runs through the cable outlets and WiFi. I didn't want to install/ or have someone install ethernet ports throughout my house so I sent them back.
customer_reviews.author: Diamends

product_meta.title: TiVo Mini with IR Remote (Old Version)
product_meta.description: The TiVo Mini is a convenient, all-purpose companion to your 4-tuner (TiVo Premiere 4 or XL4) DVR. Connecting a TiVo Mini to another TV in the house makes it easy to watch live TV or recorded shows, and access web entertainment from your DVR.
feature_bullets: Watch live TV and recorded shows from your 4- or 6-tuner TiVo DVR
Share the complete TiVo experience on additional TVs in your home, no additional service fee required
Access TV and streaming content from Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu Plus, VUDU and more without switching inputs
Streams music from Pandora, Spotify, iHeartRadio and more
Schedule recordings, WishList searches and Season Pass recordings
XFINITY On Demand available to Comcast subscribers
Supports Ethernet and MoCA - does not support Wi-Fi

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars1,064 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
